name: Aeon Stone (Azure Briolette)
desc: You gain temporary Hit Points equal to twice the spell's level until your next turn.

name: Golden Legion Epaulet
desc: If you follow the issued order, you gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws against fear for the duration.

hints.desc: If you follow the issued order, you gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.
If you follow the issued order, you gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws against fear.

name: Hummingbird Wayfinder
desc: You have caused the hummingbird wayfinder to transform into a Tiny bee hummingbird, only 2 inches long. Other than the wayfinder being a visible bird, this has the effects of prying eye. In addition to Seeking through the hummingbird, you can activate any aeon stone within the wayfinder as if the wayfinder were still on your person. When the effect ends, the wayfinder transforms back to normal in its current position. Damaging the bird ends the effect but does not destroy the wayfinder.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if the wayfinder is damaged in while in bird form.

name: Hunter's Brooch
desc: By touching a weapon you wield to the symbol and uttering a plea for Erastil's steadying hand, you have granted that weapon the deadly d12 trait. Against undead, the weapon has instead gained the fatal d12 trait. This blessing lasts for 1 minute, until you score a critical hit with the weapon, or until you aren't wielding the weapon.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if you score a critical hit with the weapon or stop wielding the weapon.

hints.desc: One weapon you wield gains the deadly d12 trait. Against undead, the weapon instead gains the fatal d12 trait (second activation). This blessing lasts for 1 minute, until you score a critical hit with the weapon, or until you aren't wielding the weapon.

name: Inexplicable Apparatus
desc: You have commanded the inexplicable apparatus to magically jury-rig an item. The item is repaired, as a 3rd-level mending spell. After the duration, the item returns to its previous state of disrepair unless you�ve Repaired it before then.

name: Knapsack of Halflingkind Portal
desc:
The greater knapsack of halflingkind's fifth compartment has been unfolded into a 5-foot-diameter portal on the ground. The first person to Step into the portal from an adjacent square is teleported away. This has the same effect as an 5th-level dimension door spell, except the affected creature takes the knapsack with them. When the portal is used, or at the start of your next turn if it hasn't been used, the compartment closes automatically and can't be unfolded until the next day.

<header class='spellHeader'>Dimension Door</header>

Opening a door that bypasses normal space, you instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to a clear space within 1 mile you can see. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. If this would bring another creature with you - even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container - the spell is lost. You are temporarily immune for 1 hour.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if the portal is used. The knapsack of halflingkind doesn't automatically transfer to the affected creature.

name: Manacles of Persuasion
desc: While the manacles are locked around your wrists and you are immobilized, they begin to sap the life out of you, dealing 2 negative damage per hour until you fall unconscious. The effect is nonlethal, so the damage doesn't cause you become dying. While you are unconscious, the manacles deal no damage and allow you to recover Hit Points normally to a maximum of 10 Hit Points, at which point the manacles begin to deal damage once more. The manacles have no effect on a creature that is not immobilized.
inputRequired: Take 2 nonlethal negative damage every hour until you are unconscious. While you are unconscious, recover Hit Points normally to a maximum of 10 Hit Points, at which point the manacles begin to deal damage again.

hints.desc: While the manacles are locked around your wrists and you are immobilized, they deal 2 negative damage per hour until you fall unconscious. While you are unconscious, the manacles deal no damage and allow you to recover Hit Points normally to a maximum of 10 Hit Points, at which point the manacles begin to deal damage once more. The manacles have no effect on a creature that is not immobilized.

name: Razmiri Wayfinder Halt Poison
desc: The originator has attempted a counteract check against one poison or disease afflicting you. On a success, the effects of the poison or disease are halted for the duration. This temporarily relieves any penalties imposed by the affliction but doesn't cure the effect or count against its duration; the poison or disease is merely halted for a time, and it resumes where it left off once this effect ends.
inputRequired: Select one affliction condition that will be paused for the duration.

name: Razmiri Wayfinder Halt Poison (Originator)
desc: You have touched an adjacent creature and attempted a counteract check against one poison or disease afflicting the creature. On a success, you halt the effects of the poison or disease for the duration, rather than removing it. This temporarily relieves any penalties imposed by the affliction but doesn't cure the effect or count against its duration; the poison or disease is merely halted for a time, and it resumes where it left off once this effect ends.

name: Razmiri Wayfinder Temporary HP
desc: You have been granted |dice=3d8| 3d8 temporary Hit Points for the duration.
inputRequired: Manually set the appropriate amount of temporary Hit Points. When the condition ends, all manually added Hit Points will be lost.

name: Razmiri Wayfinder Temporary HP (Originator)
desc: You have granted the target temporary Hit Points for the duration.

name: Ring of Maniacal Devices
desc: You have created a 4th-level glyph of warding containing fireball. You can have only one glyph of warding from a ring of maniacal devices active at a time, even if you have multiple rings, and the spell ends if you lose your investiture in the ring.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if you lose your investiture in the ring.

name: Ring of Maniacal Devices (Greater)
desc: You have created a 8th-level glyph of warding containing your choice of either prismatic spray or 7th-level fireball. You can have only one glyph of warding from a ring of maniacal devices active at a time, even if you have multiple rings, and the spell ends if you lose your investiture in the ring.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if you lose your investiture in the ring.

name: Ring of the Weary Traveler
desc: You have refreshed yourself from fatigue. You can ignore the penalties from the fatigued condition. This does not remove the condition, it merely suppresses the penalties and drawbacks of having the condition. If something would cause you to become fatigued again while the ring's power is in effect, the suppression ends, and you immediately take the penalties again.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if something would cause you to become fatigued again.

name: Robe of Eyes
desc: A spell with the light trait was cast on you or your square while you were wearing the robe of eyes, and you are blinded for a number of rounds equal to the spell's level unless you succeeded at a Fortitude save against the spell's DC.

name: Secret-Keeper's Mask (Father Skinsaw)
desc: You have been dealt a bleeding wound that is particularly mutilating. The DC of flat checks to recover from the persistent bleed damage is increased by 2, and you have a -2 status penalty to Deception, Diplomacy, and Performance checks while you are bleeding and for 1 minute after you cease bleeding.
inputRequired: Remove the condition 1 minute after you stop bleeding.

name: Secret-Keeper's Mask (Father Skinsaw) (Caster)
desc: The bleeding wound you have caused is particularly mutilating. The DC of flat checks to recover from the persistent bleed damage is increased by 2, and the target creature has a -2 status penalty to Deception, Diplomacy, and Performance checks while it is bleeding and for 1 minute after it ceases bleeding.
inputRequired: Remove the condition 1 minute after the target stops bleeding.

name: Secret-Keeper's Mask (Gray Master)
desc: You have created an illusory duplicate of the item you just stole. This duplicate has the appropriate appearance and weight, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. The illusion vanishes after 10 minutes, or earlier if anyone examines or manipulates the illusory duplicate (such as to try to use it).
inputRequired: Remove the condition if anyone examines or manipulates the illusory duplicate (such as to try to use it).

name: Secret-Keeper's Mask (Reaper of Reputation)
desc: For the duration, any normal speech you utter can, at your discretion, be inaudible to all creatures except the target creature, who can hear you clearly regardless of ambient sound so long as it is within 1 mile. This ability doesn't silence magical words, such as the verbal component of spellcasting or commands to activate magic items.

hints.desc: Any normal speech you utter can, at your discretion, be inaudible to all creatures except the target creature, who can hear you clearly regardless of ambient sound so long as it is within 1 mile. This ability doesn't silence magical words, such as the verbal component of spellcasting or commands to activate magic items.

name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
desc: You gain a 20-foot climb Speed and you don't need to use your hands to Climb. However, the slippers require decent traction for you to walk on a wall, so they provide no benefit when you're moving across greased, icy, or oiled surfaces.

hints.desc: You don't need to use your hands to Climb. However, the slippers require decent traction for you to walk on a wall, so they provide no benefit when you're moving across greased, icy, or oiled surfaces.

name: Spectacles of Understanding
desc: Unfolding the spectacles onto the bridge of the nose, you gain the effects of 2nd-level comprehend language except that it applies to all languages you see rather than a single language, and it does not apply to language you hear.

name: Stalwart's Ring
desc: You have meditated on the Stalwart's Ring during your daily preparations to grant yourself 5 temporary Hit Points. These last until your next daily preparation, as long as you are wearing the ring.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if you take off the ring.

name: Sun Wheel
desc:
The sun wheel casts a shield spell benefiting you. When you use the spell to prevent damage, you prevent 10 damage instead of 5. If the attacker is adjacent to you, you can choose to deal |dice=2d6 Fire| 2d6 fire damage to it, which it gets a DC 21 basic Reflex save to resist.

If you choose to deal the fire damage, you can't Activate the sun wheel again until the next morning. If you prevent damage but don't deal the fire damage, you can use it again in 10 minutes, as normal for shield.

hints.desc: When you use the Shield spell gained from Sun Wheel to prevent damage, you prevent 10 damage instead of 5.

name: Sun Wheel Cooldown
desc: After using the sun wheel to deal fire damage, you can't Activate it again until the next morning.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if the next morning comes before your next daily preparations.

name: Goggles of Night (Major)
desc: You gain greater darkvision for the duration.

name: Warrior's Training Ring
desc: Making an attack roll with a weapon in which you are untrained, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the attack roll. If you are an expert in any weapon, you instead gain a +4 circumstance bonus to the attack roll.

name: Goggles of Night
desc: You gain darkvision for the duration.

name: Dragonscale Amulet
desc: You have taken acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage from a dragon�s Breath Weapon, and the dragonscale amulet has begun to glow brightly; your resistance against that type of damage increases to 20 for that duration.

name: Aeon Stone (Black Pearl)
desc: You receive a +4 status bonus to your saving throw against the triggering effect.

name: Aeon Stone (Orange Prism)
desc: If your next action is to Cast a Spell, that spell�s level is 1 higher (maximum 10th level) for the purposes of counteracting and being counteracted.

hints.desc: If your next action is to Cast a Spell, that spell�s level is 1 higher (maximum 10th level) for the purposes of counteracting and being counteracted.

name: Aeon Stone (Pale Orange Rhomboid)
desc: (Aeon Stone (Pale Orange Rhomboid) removes the Dead and Dying conditions, adds the Wounded 3 and Doomed 3 conditions, sets HP to 1 and then immediately ends. It can't be chosen manually.)

name: Aeon Stone (Western Star)
desc: The resonant power of the western start aeon stone allows you to render all of your aeon stones and your wayfinder invisible whenever you use its activation to gain the effects of illusory disguise.

name: Barding of the Zephyr
desc: Your companion wearing the barding is granted a fly Speed of 30 feet. Even if the companion doesn't have the mount special ability, it can still Fly while being ridden.

name: Belt of the Five Kings
desc: Your ally has granted you darkvision for the duration.

name: Belt of the Five Kings (Originator)
desc: Tightening the belt one notch, you have gained temporary Hit Points equal to your level and granted allies within 20 feet of you darkvision for the duration.

name: Berserker's Cloak
desc:
While raging, you grow jaws that deal 1d10 piercing damage and claws that deal 1d6 slashing damage and have the agile trait. This transformation is a morph effect, and both the jaws and claws are unarmed attacks in the brawling weapon group. You gain the benefits of a +1 weapon potency rune and a striking rune with these attacks (gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the weapon damage dice by one).

If you have an animal instinct and the bestial rage instinct ability, instead of gaining these unarmed attacks, your unarmed attacks from the bestial rage instinct ability gain the benefits of a +2 weapon potency rune and a greater striking rune (granting a +2 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the weapon damage dice by two).

name: Berserker's Cloak (Greater)
desc:
While raging, you grow jaws that deal 1d10 piercing damage and claws that deal 1d6 slashing damage and have the agile trait. This transformation is a morph effect, and both the jaws and claws are unarmed attacks in the brawling weapon group. You gain the benefits of a +2 weapon potency rune and a striking rune with these attacks (gaining a +2 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the weapon damage dice by one).

If you have an animal instinct and the bestial rage instinct ability, instead of gaining these unarmed attacks, your unarmed attacks from the bestial rage instinct ability gain the benefits of a +3 weapon potency rune and a major striking rune (granting a +3 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the weapon damage dice by three).

name: Boots of Elvenkind
desc: Until the end of your turn, you ignore difficult terrain when moving on the ground. If you're wearing a cloak of elvenkind, you also gain a +5-foot status bonus to your land Speed until the end of your turn.

hints.desc: You ignore difficult terrain when moving on the ground.

name: Boots of Speed
desc: You gain the quickened condition for the duration. You can use the extra action to Stride, Climb, or Swim. (You must still attempt an Athletics check for the Climb and Swim actions unless you have the appropriate movement type.)

name: Bracelet of Dashing
desc: You gain a +10-foot status bonus to Speed.

name: Cape of the Mountebank
desc: You have cast dimension door. The space you left and the one you appeared in are filled with puffs of smoke that make anyone within concealed until they leave the smoke or the end of your next turn, at which point the smoke dissipates. Strong winds immediately disperse the smoke.

name: Clandestine Cloak
desc: You become drab and uninteresting, gaining a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks and to Deception checks to Impersonate a forgettable background character, such as a servant, but also taking a -1 item penalty to Diplomacy and Intimidation checks.

hints.desc: You gain a +1 item bonus to Deception checks to Impersonate a forgettable background character, such as a servant.

name: Clandestine Cloak (Greater)
desc: You become drab and uninteresting, gaining a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks and to Deception checks to Impersonate a forgettable background character, such as a servant, but also taking a -1 item penalty to Diplomacy and Intimidation checks.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 item bonus to Deception checks to Impersonate a forgettable background character, such as a servant.

name: Cloak of Elvenkind
desc: The cloak transforms to match the environment around you and muffles your sounds, granting you a +1 item bonus to Stealth checks.

name: Cloak of Elvenkind (Greater)
desc: The cloak transforms to match the environment around you and muffles your sounds, granting you a +2 item bonus to Stealth checks.

name: Cloak of the Bat
desc: The cloak has transformed into bat-like wings that grant you a fly Speed of 30 feet.

name: Collar of Empathy
desc: You perceive through your animal companion's senses instead of your own. You can Sustain the Activation. You are unaware of your own surroundings for as long as you are using your animal companion's senses. In addition to the obvious use when you are separated from your companion, this ability might allow you to notice sounds, scents, and other stimuli that your companion's senses register but yours alone don't.

hints.desc: You perceive through your animal companion's senses instead of your own. You are unaware of your own surroundings for as long as you are using your animal companion's senses. In addition to the obvious use when you are separated from your companion, this ability might allow you to notice sounds, scents, and other stimuli that your companion's senses register but yours alone don't.

name: Cordelia's Construct Key
desc: You have created a simple animated object. The animated object has the statistics of an animated broom (Bestiary pg. 20) but has no bristles Strike and can't attack. It performs simple and broad menial tasks for you in exploration or downtime but is too slow to react to individual commands to assist you in a combat encounter.

name: Corpseward Pendant
desc: You are undetectable to undead creatures for the duration. Undead can't see, hear, or smell you, nor detect you with sensory capabilities such as scent or tremorsense. A creature can attempt a single DC 18 Will saving throw to ignore this effect. If an undead has reason to believe that undetected opponents are present, it can still attempt to Seek or Strike you. If you attempt to use a positive spell to damage undead, use Command Undead, touch or damage an undead creature, or attack any creature while warded in this manner, the pendant's effects immediately end. An undead creature who observes you in this manner or one who succeeds at the Will save is immune to the corpseward pendant for 24 hours.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if you attempt to use a positive spell to damage undead, use Command Undead, touch or damage an undead creature, or attack any creature.

name: Corpseward Pendant Immunity
desc: You are immune to the corpseward pendant, and a creature activating the pendant is not undetectable to you.

name: Diplomat's Badge
desc: You have attempted a DC 20 check to Recall Knowledge about people of a human ethnicity, a non-human ancestry, or some other type of creature. If you succeeded, the badge's bonus increases to +2 for Diplomacy checks with creatures of that group for the rest of the day.

hints.desc: The Diplomat's badge's bonus increases to +2 for Diplomacy checks with creatures of the chosen group for the rest of the day.

name: Dread Blindfold Immunity
desc: You cannot be gripped by fear by the activation of the dread blindfold for the duration.

name: Winged Boots
desc: The boots' wings animate and flap rapidly, granting you a fly Speed of 30 feet.
